This game is dogshit. The concept is there and there are lots of great things about it but overall its a waste of time. Its horribly unbalanced, it takes ages to get perks for all your favorite characters, the community is super toxic, and the developers do not listen to veteran players. I would not recommend to anyone starting fresh. People are only playing this because its the only "asymmetrical horror game" available to the large audience, but as someone who has spent several hundred hours on this game, I wish I never started. This development team is a joke.

재밌음

I can't honestly say I would recommend this game to anyone. Don't get me wrong the game is fun, down right addictive, for a while. The premise of the game is a loose 4v1 survival game. I say loose because albeit there are four survivors and one killer the survivors may not actively work together and may even end up sand bagging each other. 

The survivor's primary objective and win condition is to repair five of seven generators to power two exit gates, then open an exit gate to escape. The secondary win condition is limited (as of patch 5.3.0) to the last remaining survivor, in the form of a hatch that appears and opens providing an alternate means for the last survivor to escape.

The killer's objective and win condition is to utilize their chosen killer's power to injure, down, then hook the survivors and inevitably sacrificing them OR killing them outright (only under certain circumstances can this be done). 

The survivors have to actively evade or waste the killer's time by being chased, in the hopes that other survivors are working on generators. Being chased by the killer is an inevitability. And being chased has quite a steep learning curve to it. Likewise, utilizing each killer's power to minimize the time you spend chasing survivors has the same learning curve to it. Again, the whole interaction and gameplay is actually quite fun.

Now. The not so fun about this game. 

The grind, is atrocious. You can unlock a majority of the characters and killers with in game currency (Iridescent Shards) that are earned by completing countless tome challenges, leveling up, or as various rewards for various reasons as deemed by the devs. Each character comes with three perks that can be unlocked for other characters to use, by progressing that particular character's levels to 30, 35, and 40, by buying out their bloodweb with blood points that are earned every trial. As of patch 5.4.1 there are 29 survivors, and 26 killers that you can unlock. Once the character's perks have been unlocked at the proper level, they are now teachable to any other character. You must find it in that particular character's blood web and unlock it for them to be able to learn it and use it.

The gameplay. The amount of fun you'll have in any given trial is wholly dependent upon how the other team plays. In regards to the killer, you can be bullied by groups of survivors equipped with various means and items to make your time in that trial a living hell. Likewise with the survivors, you can encounter killer players who will utilize rather scummy tactics to get their win, such as tunneling (going after a survivor that was just unhooked), slugging (leaving a downed survivor on the ground), and camping (lingering around a hooked survivor). These are legitimate killer tactics don't get me wrong. However, there is a limited number of situations to utilize them. Using them outside of those situations just makes the game unfun for the unfortunate victim who is subjected to it.

The bugs. At this point in the game's life there are countless bugs that crop up some of them are minor and not even noticed. Others have the potential to make the trial unwinnable by one side or the other. And with every new change to the game, a new bug or bugs crop up.

The community. The community itself is moderately toxic. It's a pvp game, the odds of there being trash talk in post game chat is high. Also, there are streamers/content creators that are partnered with the devs under their "Fog Whisperer" program for the most part many of them are genuinely wholesome people. However, some of them are down right apathetic to the next point, which in turn influences their followers to be equally apathetic to it.

The cheaters. The amount of script kiddies that play this game is note worthy. And there isn't really anything you can do to combat it as a player, despite there being an in game report feature. The general consensus is that it actually doesn't really do anything in the first place.

The devs. There is absolutely no transparency in regards to what they do to reports of cheaters. It is widely believed that any in game reports of are just ignored entirely. Their website does have a report feature and in order for them to do something they pretty much require video proof of it. Any actions taken or not, is not divulged to the community in any way. Any sort of issues caused in game by any sort of changes to the game? Expect some free blood points in game as hush money until they can figure out how to fix it and patch it out. In stead of actually working to balance out particularly powerful play styles (tunneling, camping, and slugging) they will just release perks that soft counter them.

After dumping nearly 1k hours into the game. It is a frustratingly fun game, but I would not recommend it to any new players.
